items.sentence: Tom buttoned up his shirt and then put on his tie.
If you want to change your mind, it\'s OK with me.
I want you to have opportunities that I never had.
What makes you think that I want to be left alone?
What was your favorite book when you were a child?
Don\'t you think you\'ll ever move back to Boston?
Tom keeps an extra tie in his desk drawer at work.
Tom says that learning a foreign language is hard.
I\'ve already told Tom what he should say to Mary.
I\'ve already told Tom what to bring to the party.
Don\'t forget to do that today before you go home.
Everybody looked at Tom as if he\'d lost his mind.
Tom especially likes going to Italian restaurants.
I wasn\'t expecting to be back here again so soon.
I\'ve never seen this kind of thing happen before.
It\'s really not as hard to do as you think it is.
Maybe this isn\'t the right time to be doing this.
Tom and I often help each other with our homework.
I\'m interested in learning how to play the banjo.
I don\'t care if you\'re busy. Please help me now.
I don\'t care what Tom says. I\'m not going to go.
I don\'t care whether he\'ll lend it to me or not.
Tom stopped running and tried to catch his breath.
Tom walked away and soon disappeared into the fog.
We\'re still trying to figure out how Tom escaped.
Tom lost his passport and didn\'t know what to do.
Tom made it clear that he didn\'t want to be here.
Tom made it clear that he didn\'t want to do that.
Tom made it clear that he didn\'t want to help us.
Tom leaned back and put his hands behind his head.
Tom likes to come here every year on his birthday.
There\'s a sticker on the box that says "fragile."
There\'s no doubt that Tom used to live in Boston.
Tom is trying to make the best of a bad situation.
Was the book you were reading yesterday in French?

You don\'t have to eat this if you don\'t want to.
I watched Tom\'s new video, but I didn\'t like it.
I don\'t want Tom to go out after dark by himself.
Tom scored three touchdowns in last night\'s game.
Tom says he doesn\'t know when the meeting starts.
You shouldn\'t take the things Tom says seriously.
You\'ll be able to see the difference very easily.
Are you seriously thinking about getting involved?
I don\'t want to discuss Tom\'s problems with you.
You shouldn\'t drink so much coffee late at night.
Would you like to go out and get something to eat?
I pretended that I didn\'t know what was going on.
You don\'t have to eat that if you don\'t want to.
